content: georgia knitter original design no-sew crocheted soap sack © 2013 lois mitchell georgiaknitter@gmail com 404 514-7325 version 1 0 5/2013 page 1 skill level easy skills include single_crochet in underside loops and in back loops of foundation chain and double_crochet size one size about 3 by 5 to fit ivory bar soap materials ● 20 grams approximately 40 yards of worsted weight cotton yarn sample made in hobby lobby s i love this cotton and lily s sugar n cream ● crochet hook size h-7 4 5 mm or size needed for gauge ● split-ring or locking stitch marker to mark beginning of each round ● large-eye blunt yarn needle ● small amount of lace or ribbon optional in place of crocheted drawstring gauge 3 5 single_crochet = 1 inch 4 5 single_crochet row = 1 inch be sure to check your gauge abbreviations single_crochet single_crochet double_crochet double_crochet notes 1 bag is worked in the round from the bottom up 2 this pattern is a no-sew version of lion brand pattern l10752 3 as written this soap sack is a snug fit for a bar of ivory soap add more stitches and/or rounds for a more generous fit sack begin at lower edge chain 12 set-up round turn and single_crochet in the underside loops of 11 chains continue do not turn work and single_crochet in back loops of the same 11 chains working over the yarn tail this leaves a seam on the bottom of the sack round 1 do not turn work but continue to work in rounds single_crochet in first single_crochet of set-up round place marker to mark beginning of round and single_crochet in each single_crochet around round 2-18 single_crochet in first single_crochet of previous round place marker to mark beginning of round single_crochet in each single_crochet around continue until your sack is approximately 4 tall lois mitchell georgiaknitter@gmail com 404 514-7325 version 1 0 5/2013 page 2 round 19 eyelet slip_stitch in first single_crochet of previous round and chain 3 counts as double_crochet and chain 1 *skip one single_crochet and double_crochet in next single_crochet chain 1* repeat between * * s until one single_crochet before beginning chain 3 slip_stitch into 2nd chain of chain 3 round 20 2 single_crochet in first chain-1 space *single_crochet in next double_crochet single_crochet in next chain-1 space * to end of round round 21 single_crochet in first single_crochet of previous round place marker to mark beginning of round single_crochet in each single_crochet to end of round round 22 top edging single_crochet in first single_crochet of previous round place marker to mark beginning of round *chain 1 single_crochet in next single_crochet* repeat between * * s to final single_crochet of previous round chain 1 slip_stitch in first single_crochet of round finish off crocheted drawstring optional make a chain about 15 long slip_stitch in 2nd chain from hook and in each chain across fasten_off and weave in ends and trim ribbon or lace drawstring optional measure approximately 15 of ribbon or lace finishing weave
